definition: (idiomatic usage) with great difficulty/to have a hard time (convincing sb, relinquishing sth etc)/(literal usage) so easy
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
surname Rong
to hold/to contain/to allow/to tolerate/appearance/look/countenance
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: We choose to go to the moon and other things, not because they are easy, but because they are hard.
sentences.chinese: 好容易翻完這麼長這麼專業的東西居然沒人認領？

sentences.english: I just managed to get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 我好容易及時趕到那裏。

sentences.english: According to their own accounts, they had barely managed to scrape through .
sentences.chinese: 按照他們自己的說法，他們好容易才勉強對付過去的。

sentences.english: They had a hard time finding my place.
sentences.chinese: 他們好容易才找到我這兒。
她好容易才忍住了眼淚。

sentences.english: After a while, the rain finally stopped and the sky cleared up. I hurried down the slope.
sentences.chinese: 一會兒好容易雨晴了，連忙走下坡兒去。

sentences.english: With Mainland China only a stone's throw away, escaping for a weekend is easy and cheap.
sentences.chinese: 中國大陸繫好近住，星期尾去中國好容易同埋好平。
他好容易才通過了考試。

sentences.english: Towards night I got with some difficulty into my house.
sentences.chinese: 到了傍晚時分，我好容易才爬進了房子。

sentences.english: In fact, I am a person who is easy crying.
sentences.chinese: 其實，我是一個好眼淺既人，我好容易喊。

sentences.english: After squelching along a muddy road for a long, hard time, he finally got home.
sentences.chinese: 他咕嘰咕嘰的走在泥濘的路上，好容易纔到家。

definition: with great difficulty/very difficult
at long last/finally/on the whole
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
(coll.) a long time
tremendous strength (idiom)
pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: to cause or lead to sth bad
erhua variant of 差點|差点[cha4 dian3]
just/simply/stubbornly/really
to find
quite a while
to try one's very best to persuade sb (idiom)/to reason with sb in every way possible
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
fortunately/luckily/(sarcastic) fancy that, how fortunate!
hurriedly
to have no alternative/to be helpless
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
